Based on your preferences, I would recommend "The Good German" (2006) directed by David O'Hara.

The story revolves around a Jewish American soldier who returns from Vietnam in the midst of the Cold War and the rise of the Nazi Party in Germany.
He becomes involved with his former mistress and his driver, who are also connected to the Nazi Party and its activities in Germany during this time period.
As he delves deeper into this web of interconnected people and their connections to the Nazi Party and its activities in Germany during this time period, he is forced to confront his own personal and political beliefs and how they compare to those of others around him.

Based on the user's preference cues, here are some potential recommendations:

- "You" (2014) - A movie about a young man who receives a message about a murder and his only son. The moment Danny received the message about the murder of Itzik, his only son, his life would never again be the same.

- "Holes" (2006) - A movie about an apartment building superintendent Cleveland Heep rescues what he thinks is a young woman from the pool he maintains. - "Pride and Prejudice" (1813) - A classic romance novel by Jane Austen. The story follows the relationship between two young women from different social classes: Elizabeth Bennet, an intelligent and adventurous young woman from a middle-class family, and Mr. Darcy, a wealthy and reserved young man from a higher-class family.

The novel explores themes such as love, social class, marriage, and pride. It is considered one of the most famous and beloved works of literature in history.
